sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A fine of around 1.5 million euros for 17 tax offences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Outside the court, lawyers for the Trump organisation discussed the sentence handed down to the family business of former US President Donald Trump.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's the maximum amount allowed for the crimes perpetrated by some of the company's executives, who dodged personal income taxes on luxurious employment perks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: While the fine is very small compared to the Trump organisation's revenues, it has a damaging symbolic effect.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The company says they'll appeal the sentence, saying it was politically motivated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Trump himself was not on trial and denied any knowledge of his executives evading taxes illegally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: any knowledge of his executives evading taxes illegally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A UK court has acquitted French footballer Benjamin Mendy of six counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Manchester City star was cleared unanimously after a five-month trial at Chester Crown Court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, the 28-year-old, who became the world's most expensive defender six years ago after he was signed to the top club, has a second trial pending.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The jury was unable to reach a verdict on the alleged rape and attempted rape of two women in 2020 and 2018, respectively.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Mendy previously pleaded not guilty to all charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: An explosion in a gas pipeline in central Lithuania sent flames 50 metres into the air on Friday and forced the evacuation of a nearby village, according to officials.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Local media said there were no reports of injuries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Firefighters were at the scene quickly but could do little other than look on while the remaining gas in the pipe was still burning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The operator company, Amber Grid, immediately cut off the tap on the pipeline, which runs parallel to another one and transports natural gas from Klaipeda on the Lithuanian coast to Latvia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Local media reported the Latvian energy minister as saying he'd been told the incident was a technical accident.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After being acquitted of fraud charges, former Czech Prime Minister Andrei Babis is in poll position in his country's presidential election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He's among eight candidates on the ballot, with voting spread over two days. But the billionaire businessman faces a stiff challenge from retired army general Petro Pavel. He is a political newcomer like the other main contender,ist Danusa Nerudova.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Pre-election polls suggest no candidate would win the election outright, so a run-off vote between the two top candidates appears likely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Polling also indicates both Pavel and Nerudova would defeat Bavis in a final round.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The winner will replace the outspoken and Eurosceptic Milas Seaman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He was the first president to be elected by popular vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The role is largely ceremonial, but has become more politically resonant under Zeman's term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Germany is about to drop the last of its restrictions linked to the Covid-19 pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The German Health Minister has announced that as of February 2nd, masks will no longer be required on long-distance trains and buses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The regulation was to have been in force until April 7th, but the government has decided that's no longer necessary as the pandemic situation has subsided.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However, authorities are encouraging vulnerable people to continue to wear masks when indoors and on public transport on a voluntary basis and out of personal responsibility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Germany is one of the last European countries where it is obligatory to wear masks on long distance public transport.

sentences.sentence: This drawing, which has captivated millions of readers over several generations around the world, is the original cover of Tintin in America, one of the best-known episodes of the saga of the Belgian comic book hero.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
